snippet: LEAD: For the last six weeks, 15 prison inmates have assembled daily in a classroom here to consider the harm they have caused others, including the strangers they have assaulted, robbed or raped and the family members they have abused, stigmatize...
lead_paragraph: LEAD: For the last six weeks, 15 prison inmates have assembled daily in a classroom here to consider the harm they have caused others, including the strangers they have assaulted, robbed or raped and the family members they have abused, stigmatized or left abandoned.

headline.main: Inmates Find Ways to Lock Anger Inside

byline.original: By JANE GROSS, Special to the New York Times
